newsitem.title: ITALY: Bank Italy rate policy perhaps excessive - Visco.
newsitem.headline: Bank Italy rate policy perhaps excessive - Visco.

text.p: The Bank of Italy's tight monetary policy is "understandable...but perhaps, this time, excessive," Finance Minister Vincenzo Visco said on Thursday.

Visco told reporters a combination of the government's budget plans, forthcoming negotiations with the unions on planned welfare reform and the realisation that government was working on the accounts should be enough to convince the central bank to cut rates.
"Monetary policy in Europe and Italy could be a very useful factor for (economic) development," he said.
Turning to the position of state accounts, he said June tax returns were "in line with forecasts".

"We can rest easy on the possibility of hitting the three percent deficit/gross domestic product target" in 1997, he said, referring to a key entry criterion for Europe's single currency, to be launched in 1999. -- Rome newsroom +396 6782501
